originalTitle: South Africa and Israel expel each other's envoys in diplomatic row
title: South Africa and Israel expel each other's envoys in diplomatic row
content: South Africa accuses the Israeli envoy of insulting President Ramaphosa. Israel says the expulsion is "baseless".

originalTitle: Music legend Fela Kuti becomes first African to get Grammys Lifetime Achievement Award
title: Our Own Fela Kuti Wins a Huge Music Award!
content:
Hello, Music Lovers!

Hi everyone! Your friendly African news reporter is here! I have some super exciting news for all of you. It's about music, dancing, and a very special person from our beloved Africa. Get ready to clap your hands and tap your feet! Something wonderful just happened. It makes all of us, from every corner of Africa, feel very, very proud!

A Special Man Named Fela Kuti

Do you know who Fela Kuti is? He was a real music superstar! Fela Kuti was from a country called Nigeria. Nigeria is in West Africa. Maybe you live in West Africa too! Fela loved making music more than anything. His music was so lively and full of energy! He made people want to dance, dance, dance! He made them smile. Fela was a very important person. He used his music to share his thoughts and feelings with the world. He was truly a legend! Did you know? Fela Kuti's full name was Olufela Olusegun Oludotun Ransome-Kuti! That's a very long name! Most people just called him Fela for short.

What is a Grammy Award?

Imagine the biggest, most important awards for music in the whole wide world! Those are called Grammy Awards. They are like golden trophies given to the best singers, musicians, and songwriters. It's like getting a gold medal in a music competition, but even bigger and more special! Only the very, very best musicians get a Grammy Award. It shows they are amazing at what they do. Think of it like a super special badge of honor for people who make incredible music that touches many hearts. It's a big deal in the music world.

The Lifetime Achievement Award

Now, Fela Kuti didn't just get *any* Grammy. He got a super-duper special one! It's called the 'Lifetime Achievement Award.' What does 'Lifetime Achievement' mean? It means you've made amazing music for a very, very long time. It means your music has touched many hearts and made a big difference for many, many years. It's like saying, 'Wow, Fela! You were awesome your whole life for music!' It's the biggest thank you a musician can get for their whole musical journey. It celebrates all their hard work and creativity. Did you know? This award is given to musicians who have made special contributions to music history. It means their music will be remembered forever!

First African to Win This Big Award!

Here's the really, really exciting part! Fela Kuti is the FIRST EVER person from Africa to get this special Lifetime Achievement Award from the Grammys! Can you believe it? This is a huge moment for Africa! It shows the whole world that African music is super special, super good, and super important. Our sounds are being celebrated on a global stage. It's like when your team wins a big game, and everyone cheers for you! But this is for all of Africa and our amazing music! We can all cheer for Fela and for our continent. This award shines a bright light on the wonderful talent that comes from Africa. It makes us feel very, very proud to be African.

Getting an Award After Many Years

Fela Kuti is not with us anymore. He passed away many years ago, almost 30 years ago, when you were not even born yet! But his music is still alive! Because his music is so important and still makes people happy, he is getting this award now. His songs continue to make people dance and think, even today. When someone gets an award after they have passed away, we say they get it 'posthumously.' It means 'after death.' Isn't that interesting? It means they are getting a prize for all the good things they did while they were alive, even if they are not here to pick it up themselves. Their family will accept it for him.

What Kind of Music Did Fela Make?

Fela Kuti made a very special kind of music called 'Afrobeat.' Can you say Afrobeat? 'Afro-beat!' It sounds exciting, doesn't it? Afrobeat is a mix of African music, jazz music, and funk music. It has amazing drums, cool guitars, and lots of brass instruments like trumpets and saxophones. Fela would sing and play his saxophone with his big band. His songs were often long and full of powerful messages. They made you want to move and listen carefully. Did you know? Fela Kuti made his own special music called Afrobeat! He was like a music inventor, creating a whole new sound for the world!

Fela's Powerful Music

Fela didn't just make music for dancing. He also used his music to talk about important things. He sang about making things better for people in his country and beyond. He wanted people to be treated fairly and for everyone to have a good life. His songs were like stories that made people think about how to make the world a better place. He used his music to speak up, just like a brave superhero uses their power to help others. His songs had strong messages about freedom and justice. His music showed that songs can be more than just pretty sounds. They can be tools for change and for making people aware of what is happening around them.

A Proud Moment for Africa

So, Fela Kuti, our very own music hero from Nigeria, getting this amazing Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award is a super proud moment for all of us in Africa. It tells the whole world that African music has a special place in the hearts of many. It shows our rhythms, our sounds, and our stories are important and loved. It means that kids like you, who love to sing and dance, can dream big! Maybe one day, you too can make music that makes the world happy and proud! Did you know? Fela Kuti's children also became famous musicians, keeping his music and his special Afrobeat sound alive for new generations!

Let's Celebrate Fela!

Let's all cheer for Fela Kuti! Hip hip hooray for Fela! His music lives on, and now, the whole world is giving him a super big thank you! Keep dancing, keep singing, and remember the amazing music of Fela Kuti! What a wonderful day for African music!
summary: A famous Nigerian music maker named Fela Kuti won a very special Grammy Award for all the amazing music he made, making him the first African to get this huge prize for his whole life's work.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows everyone how special African music is and how Fela Kuti made music that helped people think and dance, making all of Africa super proud that one of our own is celebrated worldwide.

originalTitle: Burkina Faso junta announces ban on all political parties
title: Burkina Faso junta announces ban on all political parties
content: The multiparty system had been "promoting division among citizens", the country's interior minister said.

title: Journalist Don Lemon arrested in connection to Minnesota ICE protest
content: Press freedom groups decry arrest of former CNN anchor as lawyer pledges to fight charges 'vigorously'.

originalTitle: MSF says it will not hand over staff details to Israeli authorities
title: MSF says it will not hand over staff details to Israeli authorities
content: The Israel’s military has killed more than 1,700 health workers since the start of the war.

originalTitle: Can Trump’s ‘madman theory’ reshape Iran and the Middle East?
title: Can Trump’s ‘madman theory’ reshape Iran and the Middle East?
content: The 'madman theory' aims to pressure adversaries but risks backfiring when opponents feel they have nothing to lose.

originalTitle: UN risks 'imminent financial collapse', secretary general warns
title: UN risks 'imminent financial collapse', secretary general warns
content: António Guterres says the international body could run out of money by July due to members' unpaid fees.

originalTitle: Trump picks Kevin Warsh to lead the US Federal Reserve
title: Trump picks Kevin Warsh to lead the US Federal Reserve
content: The 55-year-old economist had been considered for Fed chair during Trump's first term.

originalTitle: Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty if convicted, judge rules
title: Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty if convicted, judge rules
content: A judge dismisses two federal counts against the 27-year-old, but he still faces state murder charges.

originalTitle: Carrick not ruling out Man Utd deadline day moves
title: Carrick not ruling out Man Utd deadline day moves
content: Manchester United's interim head coach Michael Carrick is not ruling out the possibility of the club doing business on transfer deadline day

originalTitle: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
title: Benfica meet Real in play-offs after dramatic league phase encounter
content: Benfica will face Real Madrid in the Champions League play-offs just three weeks after their dramatic league phase encounter.

originalTitle: Celtic to play Stuttgart & Forest face Fenerbahce in Europa play-offs
title: Celtic to play Stuttgart & Forest face Fenerbahce in Europa play-offs
content: Celtic will play Stuttgart and Nottingham Forest will face Fenerbahce in two-legged play-offs to reach the last 16 of the Europa League.
